intro: Conospermum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, bell-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are an important food source for native pollinators. Conospermum lanceolatum is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
